Class CoreCalendar

java.lang.Object

public class CoreCalendar
extends java.lang.Object

This class has some useful date/time methods

Author:
Michelle Bachler

Method Detail

getLocaleDateString

public static java.lang.String getLocaleDateString(java.util.Date oDate,
                                                   java.lang.String sFormat)
This method returns a string for the given date in the given format. It allows for Locale.UK hour changes.

Parameters:
Date - date, the date to get the String representation for.
String - format, the format to use for the String representation of the given date.
Returns:
String, a String representation of the given date in the given format.

getCurrentLocaleDate

public static java.util.Date getCurrentLocaleDate()
This method returns a Date for the current date/time. It allows for Locale.UK hour changes.

Returns:
Date, a Date representing the current date/time.

getLocaleDate

public static java.util.Date getLocaleDate(long millis)
This method returns a Date for the given number of millisecond. It allows for Locale.UK hour changes.

Returns:
Date, a Date representing the given number of milliseconds.

getDateString

public static java.lang.String getDateString(java.util.Date oDate,
                                             java.lang.String sFormat)
This method returns a String for the passed date in the given format.

Parameters:
Date - date the date to convert to the given format.
String - format, the format to use for the String representation of the current date.
Returns:
String a String representation of the current date in the given format.
See Also:
getCurrentLocaleDate(), getLocaleDateString(java.util.Date, java.lang.String)

getCurrentLocaleDateString

public static java.lang.String getCurrentLocaleDateString(java.lang.String sFormat)
This method returns a String for the current date in the given format.

Parameters:
String - format, the format to use for the String representation of the current date.
Returns:
String a String representation of the current date in the given format.
See Also:
getCurrentLocaleDate(), getLocaleDateString(java.util.Date, java.lang.String)

getCurrentDate

public static java.util.Date getCurrentDate()
This method returns the current Date.

Returns:
Date the current Date.
See Also:

getCurrentDateStringFull

public static java.lang.String getCurrentDateStringFull()
This method returns a String for the current date in the full date format. The full date format is: dd-MMMM-yyyy_hh-mm-ss

Returns:
String a String representation of the current date in the full date format.
See Also:
getCurrentLocaleDateString(java.lang.String)

getCurrentDateStringFullForFile

public static java.lang.String getCurrentDateStringFullForFile()
This method returns a String for the current date in the full date format. The full date format is: dd-MMMM-yyyy_hh-mm-ss

Returns:
String a String representation of the current date in the full date format.
See Also:
getCurrentLocaleDateString(java.lang.String)

getDateFromTime

public static java.util.Date getDateFromTime(long time)
This method returns a Date for the given number of milliseconds. It uses getLocaleDate.

Parameters:
long - time, a given number of milliseconds.
Returns:
Date a Date object for the given number of milliseconds.
See Also:
getLocaleDate(long)
